name: openssl-component-1.0.2h
description:
The OpenSSL component was detected in the /usr/bin/openssl binary file, with version 1.0.2h (released on May 3, 2016). This version contains multiple critical vulnerabilities:
- CVE-2016-2177 (CVSS 9.8): Pointer arithmetic error leading to heap buffer boundary check issues
- CVE-2016-2176 (CVSS 8.2): Buffer over-read vulnerability in X509_NAME_oneline function
- CVE-2016-2105 (CVSS 7.5): Integer overflow in EVP_EncodeUpdate function
It is recommended to upgrade to OpenSSL 1.0.2u or later.
notes: Version evidence location: Offset 0x0006930e in the usr/bin/openssl binary file. 32-bit ARM architecture ELF executable, dynamically linked to uClibc library.

name: curl-component-7.29.0
description: The curl component was found in the /usr/bin/curl binary file, with version 7.29.0 (released in February 2013). This version is severely outdated (current versions are in the 8.x series) and may contain multiple known vulnerabilities. Since the NVD API is unavailable, manual research is required to confirm specific CVEs.
notes: Version evidence source: Embedded strings within the binary file. Manual research required to confirm specific CVE. Current version is severely outdated, recommend upgrading to the 8.x series.

name: busybox-telnet-component-1.4.2
description: The BusyBox component (version 1.4.2, compiled on 2018-01-05) was found in usr/bin/telnet. No known CVE vulnerabilities associated with this version were identified in the NVD database. Although no known vulnerabilities exist, it is recommended to check the telnet service configuration due to its inherent security risks.
notes: Version evidence source: Version string from the BusyBox binary. While no known vulnerabilities were identified, the telnet service itself poses security risks. It is recommended to review its configuration and usage.

name: busybox-main-component-1.4.2
description: Analysis results of the BusyBox main binary file. Version 1.4.2 (compiled on 2018-01-05). No known CVE vulnerabilities associated with this version were found in the NVD database. Although no known vulnerabilities exist, the version is outdated, and it is recommended to check for updates.
notes:
Version Evidence Sources:
1. Multiple string outputs
2. Copyright strings
3. Help text
Uses uClibc (/lib/ld-uClibc.so.0). Includes standard applets such as ifconfig, ping, etc. Dynamic analysis is recommended for supplementary evaluation.
